reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: NGO Support / Governance out of Box - Collection of birth and death data

description.narrative: Countries need to know how many people are born and die each year in order to make informed policy and resourcing decisions. In Liberia this information is lacking. The only way to keep track is through civil registration. Civil registration is also needed to safeguard individual rights to social status and benefits. The practical aim of CMI's birth registration pilot project in Liberia (2009) is to have a functioning mobile birth registration data collation system supporting the computerization of birth re gistration process in one county. New funding is applied for 2010-12 to expand the system to all 15 counties. The general aim is to learn how a mobile birth registration data collation tool can facilitate and bring added value to the computerizing of the b irth registration process and through that function, become a population information collation tool to other countries too.
